div.p: ANTONIO: We all make our own choices, and sometimes we're influenced in ways we don't even realize.
ANTONIO: This doesn't mean that alcohol and drug problems are society's fault. But social factors do influence rates of alcoholism and addiction.
ANTONIO: We also know that advertisers take psychological research, and use it to influence customers. But high-risk messages don't cause alcoholism or addiction.
ANTONIO: Once we become aware of the situations and messages that influence usâ€”it's less likely we'll be subconsciously influenced by them.
ANTONIO: Now, let's look at an example of how all these factors relate in the development of alcoholism or drug addiction.
